trans-unit.source: Retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with a specified rectangle

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with a specified rectangle

target.mrk: Retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with a specified rectangle

trans-unit.source: $tagRECT structure that specifies the rectangle of interest in virtual-screen coordinates.

seg-source.mrk: $tagRECT structure that specifies the rectangle of interest in virtual-screen coordinates.

target.mrk: $tagRECT structure that specifies the rectangle of interest in virtual-screen coordinates.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The flag that specifies the function's return value if the rectangle does not intersect any display

seg-source.mrk: The flag that specifies the function's return value if the rectangle does not intersect any display

target.mrk: The flag that specifies the function's return value if the rectangle does not intersect any display

trans-unit.source: monitor. This parameter can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: Returns the handle to the monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the rectangle,

seg-source.mrk: Returns the handle to the monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the rectangle,

target.mrk: Returns the handle to the monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the rectangle,

trans-unit.source: or the value depends on the $MONITOR_* constant.

seg-source.mrk: or the value depends on the $MONITOR_* constant.

target.mrk: or the value depends on the $MONITOR_* constant.
